section.p: GLPI has a search engine that displays a set of elements satisfying multiple criteria. A global search engine (that can use data from objects of different types) is also available.
These lists of items offer two additional features: export and massive change.
Finally, a complete system of bookmarks allows you to save favorite searches.

section.title: Basic Search
section.p: Basic search enables you to search multiple parameters and filter on one of the types of inventory.
Next the data on which the search is conducted, the following operators can be proposed: contains, is, is not, before, after.

Search dates to specify a specific date (Specify a date) or by defining it to be compared to the current date (Now, + or - X hour(s), date(s), month ou year(s)). It is also possible to specify a search before or after a given date, as well as predefined intervals (last Monday, beginning of the month, beginning of the year, etc.).
For headings, you can search for a given value (is). If the labels can be seen in sub-entities, the option under appears.

example.p: Search computers with more than 1024 MB of memory and over 80% of free disk space :
Memory (MB) contains > 1024 AND (simple search) Volumes Free percentage contains > 80 .

section.title: Multiple Search Criteria
section.p: The multi-criteria search allows you to refine the search by extending it to other object types through the addition of Global search criteria. Such research is obtained by adding criteria with the "+" with a triangle red in the background.

body.example: Search computers with more than 1024 MB of memory and over 80% of free disk space attached to a 17-inch monitor and have LibreOffice software installed :

ul.li: AND (simple search) Volumes Free percentage contains > 80
AND (multi-criteria) for which Monitor Size contains 17
AND (multi-criteria) for which Software Name contains LibreOffice

section.title: Deleted Items
section.p: Deleted items in GLPI are stored in a basket. To view them in order to restore or purge, click the trash can icon. To return to the display of the active elements, click again this icon.

section.title: Advanced Search
section.p: Some examples of search operators :

plentry.pd: search records with such empty field

plentry.pt: with a date field : < number_of_months or > number_of_months
plentry.pd: search for materials with a period corresponding to the number of months
find computers 5 years old: : Date of purchase contains < -60
search for records containing 123 at the start of field
Warning, you must type ^ then the space bar and then the first character.
search for records containing Windows 2000, Windows XP but not with Windows
search for records containing 123 at the end of the field
search for records containing only text 123.

plentry.pt: two search criteria associated with the AND NOT operator
plentry.pd: find records that do not correspond to a criteria (different)

plentry.pt: Type = blank (to select all) AND NOT Type = Laptop
plentry.pd: search all computers that are not laptop, i.e. Type different than Laptop. Sample search "different than"
For reasons of security, the operator \ cannot be used.

section.title: Export search results
section.p: Export the search result formats for SLK or CSV spreadsheet, or PDF may be made in two different forms: current page exports only the data displayed on the screen (e.g. 10 of the first 200 results) while all pages exports all the search results.

SLK format is readable by many spreadsheet programs. Fields that are too long are truncated when using software that does not fully meet the standards. It is preferable in this case to use the CSV export format.
If the exported data in CSV format are imported into Microsoft Excel, accented characters may not display properly. This software seems to have problems with the UTF-8 data encoded.
The PDF export does not currently support UTF-8. The display of non-Latin characters (for example Chinese or Cyrillic) is not supported.

section.title: Make massive modifications
section.p: A system of massive change is integrated into the search engine. It can make changes all selected items (Remove, Purge, Restore, Connect / Disconnect, Install, Update fields, add a document or contract, Enable financial and administrative information, Transfer or Synchronize). Once the type of change is selected, options are possibly presented and an update button.

section.title: Quick Search
section.p:
The Quick Search Box
This tool is located in the upper right corner. GLPI allows the search for a string simultaneously on the following items: Computer, Monitor, Software, Network Hardware, Peripherals, Printers, Telephones, Contacts, Documents and Suppliers.
section.note: The search will be made only on the fields displayed by default for each elements mentioned above.

section.title: Bookmarks
section.p: GLPI can save searches that the user wants to keep as personal or public bookmarks and run them again if necessary.
A public bookmark can not be changed on the entity in which it was created. Only persons with write permission on public bookmarks are empowered to create and modify existing ones.
Also a bookmark can be set as the default bookmark, and will be loaded on each start GLPI. Republish the bookmark and set it to yes on Default View.
To reload a bookmark, select the bookmark you want by clicking the Load bookmark icon after the second breadcrumb.

body.example: If managers regularly need to know all the machines running GNU / Linux with more than 512 MB memory, then create a bookmark public.
In the case multi-entity GLPI is used, to make the public bookmarks that are not editable available to users, it is possible to create the public bookmarks to be visible in sub-entities.
